poem:
### Sudden Dusk Over the Iberian Peninsula

This morning, a hand reached for the switch,  
and I imagined a vast ripple of darkness,  
a cloth drawn over the peninsula—  
trains stalled mid-sentence,  
a chorus of unanswered phones,  
streetlights blinking with uncertainty,  
as millions wondered in the stillness  
when the sun might return  
to light their little squares of the world.
